intro: Nolana bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteosa nolana, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Chile and Argentina. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and produces bracts that are often mistaken for leaves. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
